statement.p: Kayla is conducting market research on the cost of a cell phone data plan. Kayla has determined that the average annual cost of a cell phone data plan is 1129, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 80.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1029 on a cell phone data plan.
b. The cost of the middle 70 of cell phone data plans falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 16 of cell phone data plans cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 70 of the data, need the remaining 30 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.15} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.15} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.85} to the left.
